title: Mercedes-Maybach GLS 600 Night Series launched at Rs 3.71 crore
description: Mercedes-Benz India has launched the new Maybach GLS 600 Night Series at a starting price of Rs 3.71 crore. Positioned at the top of the Maybach GLS range, the new variant adds purely cosmetic upgrades for around Rs 25 lakh over the current model. Mercedes also launched a Night Series variant of the Maybach EQS 680 SUV at the Auto Expo 2025. The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series gets bespoke dual-tone paint and all-black flourishes The equipment list remains the same as the Maybach GLS 600 top-spec variant The Maybach GLS Night Series features no mechanical changes Maybach GLS 600 Night Series exterior The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series sports the hallmark dual-tone paint scheme of Maybach cars, with a Mojave Silver finish on the upper portion of the SUV and Onyx Black on the lower portion. Much of the exterior fitments are blacked-out to fit the theme, and the front grille panel and headlights feature rose gold inserts. Additionally, the SUV gets all-black Maybach-spec 22-inch wheels that look virtually identical to the ones found on the Maybach EQS 680 SUV Night Series. Maybach GLS 600 Night Series interior The interior of the Maybach GLS 600 Night Series carries forward the blacked-out exterior theme. The seats are wrapped in bespoke Nappa leather with wood and aluminium accents, and the all-digital instrument cluster also gets an exclusive Night Series animation. The SUV’s equipment list and overall cabin layout are otherwise retained from the Maybach GLS 600 top-spec variant, with features like a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment unit, 27-speaker sound system, 64-colour ambient lighting, and more. Maybach GLS 600 Night Series powertrain The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series sees no mechanical changes and is, therefore, equipped with the same 550hp, 4.0-litre twin-turbo V8 petrol engine, which does duty in the standard Maybach GLS 600. The motor is assisted by a 48V mild-hybrid setup, which provides a 250Nm boost for a total output of 770Nm of torque. Coupled with a 9-speed automatic transmission sending power to all four wheels, the SUV can despatch the 0-100kph run in 4.9 seconds. html:
The new blacked-out variant sits at the top of the Maybach GLS line-up.

Mercedes-Benz India has launched the new Maybach GLS 600 Night Series at a starting price of Rs 3.71 crore. Positioned at the top of the Maybach GLS range, the new variant adds purely cosmetic upgrades for around Rs 25 lakh over the current model. Mercedes also launched a Night Series variant of the Maybach EQS 680 SUV at the Auto Expo 2025.

  1. The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series gets bespoke dual-tone paint and all-black flourishes
  2. The equipment list remains the same as the Maybach GLS 600 top-spec variant
  3. The Maybach GLS Night Series features no mechanical changes

Maybach GLS 600 Night Series exterior

The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series sports the hallmark dual-tone paint scheme of Maybach cars, with a Mojave Silver finish on the upper portion of the SUV and Onyx Black on the lower portion. Much of the exterior fitments are blacked-out to fit the theme, and the front grille panel and headlights feature rose gold inserts. Additionally, the SUV gets all-black Maybach-spec 22-inch wheels that look virtually identical to the ones found on the Maybach EQS 680 SUV Night Series.

Maybach GLS 600 Night Series interior

The interior of the Maybach GLS 600 Night Series carries forward the blacked-out exterior theme. The seats are wrapped in bespoke Nappa leather with wood and aluminium accents, and the all-digital instrument cluster also gets an exclusive Night Series animation. The SUV’s equipment list and overall cabin layout are otherwise retained from the Maybach GLS 600 top-spec variant, with features like a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment unit, 27-speaker sound system, 64-colour ambient lighting, and more.

Maybach GLS 600 Night Series powertrain

The Maybach GLS 600 Night Series sees no mechanical changes and is, therefore, equipped with the same 550hp, 4.0-litre twin-turbo V8 petrol engine, which does duty in the standard Maybach GLS 600. The motor is assisted by a 48V mild-hybrid setup, which provides a 250Nm boost for a total output of 770Nm of torque. Coupled with a 9-speed automatic transmission sending power to all four wheels, the SUV can despatch the 0-100kph run in 4.9 seconds.
